headline.main: The Home Front, Through a Child's Eyes

lead_paragraph: To the Editor: Re ''Bravery at Home,'' by Jean S. Arbeiter (Op-Ed, Nov. 23): My friend Carol and I also felt very useful during World War II. On Dec. 7, 1941, we were fifth graders at Public School 166 on Manhattan's West Side. We soon became self-appointed but sanctioned leaders of the ''silver foil collection'' drive.
abstract: Mary-Ellen Siegel letter on Jean S Arbeiter's Nov 23 article recalls own experiences as child aiding war effort at home during World War II; drawing
